Dear Parent_D,

conversation.thought: We have quota 1. Our true priority is E > B > C > D > A. In this round we received APPLY from D, A, B, C. Among these, B is highest on our list (2nd), then C (3rd), then D (4th), then A (5th). Since we can only accept one and better-ranked applicants are available now, accepting D would block us from matching with B or C. Also, Parent_B’s top choice is Nursery_A, so B may not ultimately match with us, but we should still prioritize higher-ranked applicants and avoid committing to D. Therefore reject D now.
